table1.Notes: A multi-genre cartridge that is included with the CX30+ Paddle Controller Bundle released in 2023.[5][6] Four games are included: Breakout, Canyon Bomber, Night Driver, and Video Olympics. Two paddle controllers are also included with the cartridge. CX26501

A multi-genre cartridge that is the pack-in game for the Atari 2600+. Ten games are included: Adventure, Combat, Dodge 'Em, Haunted House, Maze Craze, Missile Command, RealSports Volleyball, Surround, Video Pinball, and Yars' Revenge. CX26500
A multi-genre cartridge. It is a PAL-only release and is compatible with the Atari 7800.[7] 32 games are included, including games by Atari, Inc., Activision, CommaVid, and U.S. Games.
Contains first well-known Easter egg, containing the designer's name.

table3.Title: Alien Holocaust
table3.Notes: Based on the short film Alien Holocaust by Marcus Garrett and the developer as the character Bruce. It has a cartridge version and another sold with the DVD of the short film.[30]

table3.Title: Alien Holocaust 2: Invasion Earth
table3.Notes: Sequel to Alien Holocaust. In command of flying saucers, the player can destroy cities all over the world, being the first Atari game to graphically represent cities in Brazil, North America, Europe, Asia and Egypt. With soundtrack by Pedro Pimenta. It has a special version with a flying saucer-shaped packaging.[31]

table3.Title: Astronomer
table3.Notes: A astronomy simulator where the player can use a telescope to observe stars. It is a pack in game for the Retron 77.

table3.Title: Jatai the Bee
table3.Notes: The Jataí is a bee native to the Atlantic Forest and must fulfill its duty of pollinating flowers and collecting pollen and nectar to feed the hive. During the mission, some enemies will appear: spiders, which hang from the web; lemon bees, which raid the hive; and also a large spider, the Queen, who must be stopped. The game has a box with a 3D printed bee that serves as a key to open it.[41]
